title: Installation and safety requirements for photovoltaic (PV) arrays
document_status: CURRENT - Most recent version of AS/NZS 5033

scope.primary: Safety requirements arising from particular characteristics of photovoltaic systems
scope.focus: Direct current systems and photovoltaic arrays pose hazards in addition to conventional a.c. power systems
scope.critical_hazard: Ability to produce and sustain electrical arcs with currents not greater than normal operating currents

major_revisions.scope_changes: Change in scope with respect to maximum PV array power limit
major_revisions.dc_conditioning: Additions of provisions relating to d.c. conditioning units regarding voltage and current calculations
major_revisions.protection_changes: Changes to requirements for overcurrent protection and earthing
major_revisions.isolation_updates: Changes to methods of PV isolation including for d.c conditioning units
major_revisions.wiring_updates: Changes to requirements for wiring systems and connector requirements
major_revisions.new_requirements: New signs, verification and commissioning requirements

arc_hazard_recognition.critical_safety_issue: Direct current systems can produce and sustain electrical arcs with normal operating currents
arc_hazard_recognition.limited_standards: At time of publication, limited Standards for arc detection and prevention for PV arrays
arc_hazard_recognition.future_requirements: As standards develop, there will be revision requiring use of arc detection technology for PV arrays
arc_hazard_recognition.protection_implementation: Many new protection features for arrays implemented in inverter systems

inverter_compliance.mandatory_standard: IEC 62109-2 Safety of power converters for use in photovoltaic power systems Part 2: Particular requirements for inverters
inverter_compliance.dual_requirement: Both AS/NZS 5033:2021 and AS/NZS 4777 require inverters that conform to IEC 62109-2 for grid connected PV systems
inverter_compliance.grid_connection_integration: Coordinates with AS/NZS 4777 series for complete grid-connected PV system safety

regulatory_framework.authority_timing: Regulatory authorities that reference this standard in regulation may apply requirements at different time
regulatory_framework.consultation_required: Users should consult with authorities to confirm their requirements
regulatory_framework.compliance_coordination: Must coordinate with electricity distributor and regulatory authority requirements

technical_committees.joint_committee: EL-042, Renewable Energy Power Supply Systems and Equipment
extensive_representation: Australasian Fire and Emergency Service Authorities Council
Better Regulation Division (Fair Trading, Safework NSW, TestSafe)

innovation_accommodation.existing_systems: Deals with existing types of systems
innovation_accommodation.future_technology: Not intended to discourage innovation or exclude materials, equipment and methods that may be developed in the future
innovation_accommodation.revision_process: Revisions will be made from time to time in view of developments, and amendments will be made when necessary

safety_priorities.dc_hazards: Direct current systems pose hazards in addition to conventional a.c. power systems
safety_priorities.arc_flash_risk: PV arrays can produce electrical arcs with normal operating currents
safety_priorities.system_protection: Protection features implemented in inverter systems per IEC 62109-2
safety_priorities.installation_safety: Comprehensive installation and safety requirements for PV arrays

integration_requirements.grid_connection: Works with AS/NZS 4777 series for grid-connected systems
integration_requirements.inverter_safety: Requires IEC 62109-2 compliant inverters for grid-connected applications
integration_requirements.wiring_compliance: Integrates with AS/NZS 3000 electrical installation requirements
